title: Ingénieur DevOps - Cloud - Niji H/F
description:
Les missions du poste

Localisation : Lyon (télétravail possible à raison de 2 jours par semaine)
Expérience requise : Minimum 5 ans
Type de contrat : CDI
Rémunération : Selon profil

Qui sommes nous ?

Niji est une entreprise spécialisée dans la transformation numérique.

Nous sommes le partenaire de la transformation digitale de nos clients grands comptes et ETI, que nous accompagnons de l'idée à la réalité.

Nous associons, dans une même chaîne de valeur, conseil en stratégie, design de service et design émotionnel, management et valorisation de la donnée, ingénierie et conseil technologique, réalisation logicielle et expertise en cybersécurité.

Notre singularité repose sur les talents pluriels de nos équipes, au service de la satisfaction et de la performance de nos clients.

Vos missions

Nos équipes accompagnent nos clients via une expertise plurielle en architecture et ingénierie de services dans le domaine des infrastructures de communication (fixe, mobile et IoT) y compris en environnement Cloud (AWS, Google Cloud) en intervenant dans la conception et l'intégration de plateformes de services au coeur des systèmes d'information de nos clients.

Chez Niji, nous comprenons l'importance du Cloud dans la transformation numérique des entreprises. Nous sommes spécialisés dans la conception, la mise en oeuvre et la gestion d'architectures Cloud évolutives et sécurisées, et avons des besoins croissants sur la plateforme Azure de Microsoft.

En tant que Ingénieur DEVOPS/Cloud, vos principales missions seront les suivantes :
- Concevoir, développer et maintenir les pipelines CI/CD en utilisant des services Cloud (Azure ou AWS par exemple)pour assurer un déploiement efficace des applications dans le cloud
- Mettre en place et gérer l'infrastructure Cloud pour soutenir le développement et le déploiement des applications
- Automatiser les processus de déploiement, de gestion des configurations et de surveillance des systèmes
- Collaborer avec les équipes de développement pour améliorer la fiabilité, la performance et la sécurité des applications
- Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes d'exploitation et de sécurité pour garantir la disponibilité et la résilience des infrastructures Cloud

Profil recherché

Nous recherchons une personne avec :
- 5 ans d'expérience en DEVOPS,
- Vous maîtrisez les outils : Jenkins, GIT, Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Terraform,
- Vous maîtrisez des infrastructures Clouds : Azure ou AWS,
- Une certification Cloud (par exemple AWS DEVOPS Engineer) est un plus
- Vous avez la capacité à formaliser et documenter votre travail.

L'aventure Niji :

Notre processus de recrutement se compose de plusieurs étapes :
- Un premier échange avec notre équipe de recrutement.
- Un échange avec un membre de la partie commerciale pour vous présenter la mission.
- Une validation technique sous forme d'échange avec l'un de nos consultants Senior.

Si vous vous reconnaissez dans cette annonce, alors venez participer au dynamisme de notre site en rejoignant l'équipe Lyonnaise !

Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
- Un environnement de travail stimulant avec des technologies modernes,
- Des projets variés et intéressants dans un cadre agile,
- Une équipe dynamique et bienveillante,
- Des opportunités de formation et d'évolution professionnelle,

title: DevOps Engineer (M/W)
description:
Job Description

Your job

1. Migration to Jenkins:
• Pipeline Migration: Lead the migration of our existing Azure DevOps pipelines to Jenkins, ensuring that the transition is smooth and efficient.
• Jenkins Setup: Design, build, and maintain Jenkins pipelines to support continuous integration and continuous delivery.
• Security & Code Quality Integration: Integrate SonarQube and Checkmarx into Jenkins pipelines for static code analysis and security checks.

2. Release Automation & XLRelease Integration:
• Automate Release Workflows: Leverage XLRelease to automate the deployment process, integrating ServiceNow for ticket creation and workflow automation within the release cycle.
• Versioning and Tagging: Ensure proper version control and tagging throughout the release process.

3. Migration to OpenShift & Cloud Infrastructure:
• Cloud Migration: Manage the migration of applications to OpenShift, setting up Kubernetes clusters and integrating Consul for service discovery.
• Failover and High Availability: Enhance the failover processes with dev team to ensure a robust primary-backup system for high availability and disaster recovery.

4. Testing and Monitoring:
• Automate Integration Testing: Collaborate with the development team to automate integration tests, ensuring seamless integration into the Jenkins pipelines.
• Monitoring Dashboards: Develop monitoring dashboards using Grafana or Kibana to provide real-time insights into system performance, resource usage, and application health.

5. Skills and Qualifications:
• CI/CD Tools: Strong experience with Azure DevOps, Jenkins, git, and XLRelease/XLDeploy.
• Code Quality & Security Tools: Proven experience with SonarQube and Checkmarx, especially in the context of pipeline integration.
• Cloud & Containerization: Hands-on experience with OpenShift, Kubernetes, and Consul for cloud infrastructure and orchestration.
• Automation Expertise: Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Bash, Python) to automate tasks and processes.
• Monitoring & Observability: Experience with Grafana, Kibana, or similar monitoring tools.
• Collaboration Tools: Familiarity with ServiceNow for release workflow automation.
• Testing Automation: Knowledge of testing frameworks and automation tools for integration testing.

Qualifications

Technical skills
• Kibana, Grafana,
• XlDeploy, XlRelease,
• Jenkins, GIT, Nuget, msbuild agents,
• Sonarqube, Checkmarx,
• Kubernetes, Openshift,
• Azure Devops Services,
• Scripting languages (e.g., Bash, Python),
• Knowledge in agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban, Jira).

Soft skills
• Problem-Solving: Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical challenges quickly,
• Collaboration: Strong communication and teamwork skills, able to work cross-functionally with developers, testers, and operations,
• Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities,
• A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others – and an ability to turn ideas into reality,
• Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required.

Languages
• Good level of English – minimum B2,
• French is a plus.

Additional Information

Are you ready to take on new challenges in an environment conducive to well-being?

What being a consultant at Meritis means :
• Growing in a company that encourages learning: certification training, e-learning, meetups, code competitions, career development paths, etc.
• Being part of communities of experts who share their knowledge and experience.
• Choosing your projects.
• Benefiting from a network of clients who trust us, built up over the years.
• Working in a friendly environment with many events: lunches, afterworks, teambuilding, annual parties, etc.
• Joining a company where it’s great to work, certified as a « Great Place to Work. »

Our differences are our assets. That’s why Meritis is committed to diversity and non-discrimination. All our jobs are accessible to people with disabilities. We look forward to hearing from you.

You can contact ethiquegroup@meritis.fr if you believe you are a victim or witness of discrimination.

Company Description

Meritis is an IT consulting, management and development firm founded in 2007, with offices in Paris, Sophia-Antipolis, Aix-en-Provence, Montpellier, Toulouse, Nantes, Lille, … And now Portugal ! Our mission ? To connect the best talents with companies, and give them a head start.

We support our clients in all their digital transformation needs through a wide range of areas of expertise: Software Engineering, Finance, Project Management, DevOps, Data, Cloud, Cybersecurity and Agility.

We are active in the banking, insurance, telecommunications, industry and transport sectors, and today 40% of CAC40 companies are Meritis clients.

Guided by our values of high standards, humility, benevolence and proximity, we now employ over 900 people.

We make it a point of honor to be close to our employees and to provide them with individualized support, whatever their position within the company.

Certified Great Place To Work since 2013, our concept of well-being at work goes far beyond a simple label, and it’s our employees who speak best of it: https://www.glassdoor.fr/Avis/Meritis-Avis-E1163008.htm

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Chez Sogeti, la technologie coule dans nos veines . C’est cet intérêt pour la technologie qui nous guide au quotidien et qui est reflété dans notre slogan « Made In Tech ». VOS MISSIONS

En tant que Senior DevOps Engineer chez Sogeti, vous aurez un profil administrateur (pas utilisateur) et une expertise ArtiFactory sera attendue.

Vos responsabilités seront les suivantes :
• Expertise technique sur le produit Artifactory et les pratiques associées afin de gérer les montées de version, les changements d’architecture et le support N3
• Maîtrise des socles Linux, Windows, Docker et Openshift
• Documenter les solutions (How to, maintenance fonctionnelle et technique)

• OS : Red Hat, Linux, CentOS

VOTRE PROFIL
• Vous êtes titulaire d’un BAC+3 minimum en informatique,

• Vous êtes prêt.e à vous impliquer dans les projets et à être force de proposition.

Certifications souhaitées : Gitlab Certified Git Associate, CI/CD, Security Specialist, Migration Services Specialist, Project Management Associate

3 RAISONS DE NOUS REJOINDRE
• Qualité de vie au travail : accord de télétravail en France et à l’international, accord sur l’égalité professionnelle, la parentalité, l’équilibre des temps et la mobilité durable.

• Avantages groupe & CSE : plan actionnariat, activités à tarifs préférentiels, remboursement partiel vacances, remboursement de votre abonnement sportif ou culturel.

NOS ENGAGEMENTS ET PRIORITES

Le groupe Capgemini encourage une culture inclusive dans un cadre multiculturel et handi-accueillant. En nous rejoignant, vous intégrez un collectif qui valorise la diversité, développe le potentiel de ses talents, s’engage dans des initiatives solidaires avec ses partenaires, et se mobilise pour réduire son impact environnemental sur tous ses sites et auprès de ses clients.

Sogeti fait partie du groupe Capgemini et accompagne les organisations dans leur mise en oeuvre de l'innovation , en tant que partenaire local à l'échelle mondiale . En combinant son agilité et sa rapidité Sogeti propose des solutions innovantes en testing, cloud et développement d'applications , toutes pilotées par l'IA , les données et l'automatisation . Plus d’informations sur www.sogeti.com/fr

title: Senior DevOps Engineer - Python Development Support (Remote/Hybrid)
description:
Requisition #: 15398

Ansys is now a part of Synopsys. Synopsys, Inc. (Nasdaq: SNPS) accelerates technology innovation from silicon to systems. Catalyzing the era of pervasive intelligence, we deliver design solutions, from electronic design automation to silicon IP, to system design and multiphysics simulation and analysis. We partner closely with our customers across a wide range of industries to maximize their R&D capability and productivity, powering innovation today that ignites the ingenuity of tomorrow. Learn more at www.synopsys.com.

When visionary companies need to know how their world-changing ideas will perform, they close the gap between design and reality with Ansys simulation. For more than 50 years, Ansys software has enabled innovators across industries to push boundaries by using the predictive power of simulation. From sustainable transportation to advanced semiconductors, from satellite systems to life-saving medical devices, the next great leaps in human advancement will be powered by Ansys.

Summary / Role Purpose

The Senior DevOps Engineer is responsible for the development of software products and supporting systems. In this role, the Senior DevOps Engineer will use advanced technical and problem-solving skills to design, develop, and deploy software applications for on-prem and cloud platforms using containerization technologies.

Key Duties and Responsibilities
• Participates in planning, architecture, and research around on-prem and cloud deployments.
• Performs complex development activities that may require extensive analysis in areas including user experience, software design and solver research.
• Collaborate with software engineering teams to design and create efficient, scalable, and maintainable containerized software solutions for on-prem and cloud deployments.
• Support development teams with scripting and automation tasks, primarily using Python, to enhance development workflows and system integration.
• Implement cloud deployment strategies using Kubernetes based environments, ensuring high availability, scalability, and security of applications.
• Monitor and troubleshoot cloud-based containerized applications, addressing performance issues and ensuring system stability.
• Collaborate with DevOps teams to implement CI/CD pipelines and streamline software release cycles in on-prem and cloud environments with Kubernetes.
• Works independently with minimal supervision and may take on some planning and mentoring responsibilities.
• May be responsible for managing interns or co-ops but typically does not have direct reports.

Minimum Education/Certification Requirements and Experience
• BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or Quantitative Sciences with at least 5 years of commercial experience in software development using object-oriented languages like Python or command languages like Bash.
• Commercial experience with Docker images creation and optimization.
• Experience deploying and managing containerized applications in on-prem and/or cloud environments using Kubernetes.

Preferred Qualifications and Skills
• Excellent technical knowledge and commercial experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
• Experience delivering pipelines in environments such as GitHub Enterprise Cloud, Azure DevOps Server and Services.
• Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues in cloud and on-prem environments.
• Familiarity with reverse proxies, load balancers and API gateway tools, as well as with infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.
• Certifications in relevant cloud technologies such as AWS Certified Developer, Azure Developer Associate, or Google Cloud Certified.
• Excellent verbal and written English communication skills.

At Ansys, we know that changing the world takes vision, skill, and each other. We fuel new ideas, build relationships, and help each other realize our greatest potential in the knowledge that every day is an opportunity to observe, teach, inspire, and be inspired. Together as One Ansys, we are powering innovation that drives human advancement.

Our Commitments:
• Amaze with innovative products and solutions
• Make our customers incredibly successful
• Act with integrity
• Ensure employees thrive and shareholders prosper

Our Values:
• Adaptability: Be open, welcome what’s next
• Courage: Be courageous, move forward passionately
• Generosity: Be generous, share, listen, serve
• Authenticity: Be you, make us stronger

Our Actions:
• We commit to audacious goals
• We work seamlessly as a team
• We demonstrate mastery
• We deliver outstanding results

OUR ONE ANSYS CULTURE HAS INCLUSION AT ITS CORE
We believe diverse thinking leads to better outcomes. We are committed to creating and nurturing a workplace that fuels this by welcoming people, no matter their background, identity, or experience, to a workplace where they are valued and where diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging thrive.

TAKE A LEAP OF CERTAINTY IN YOUR CAREER AT ANSYS

At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary leaders across the globe. Collectively we strive to change the world with innovative technology and transformational solutions. With a prestigious reputation in working with well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high – met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head on. Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology, empowering our customers to turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at a lower cost.

At Ansys, it’s about the learning, the discovery, and the collaboration. It’s about the “what’s next” as much as the “mission accomplished.” And it’s about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can, and do impact real people in real ways. All this is forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy, and ethics.

CREATING A PLACE WE’RE PROUD TO BE
Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a member of the NASDAQ-100. We are proud to have been recognized for the following more recent awards, although our list goes on: America’s Most Loved Workplaces, Gold Stevie Award Winner, America’s Most Responsible Companies, Fast Company World Changing Ideas, Great Place to Work Certified (China, Greece, France, India, Japan, Korea, Spain, Sweden, Taiwan, U.K.).

For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com

Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

#LI-Hybrid #LI-Remote

Rewards and Benefits:

We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

At Ansys, part of Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. We consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

From cloud infrastructure provisioning to production deployment, Qovery streamlines every step, enabling faster delivery, simplified workflows, and significant time savings.We're scaling fast, and looking for a new brilliant addition to our awesome team, an AI Fullstack Engineer.

Join Qovery to build the future of DevOps with AI.We’re developing an AI-powered DevOps Copilot, an agentic assistant that helps developers deploy, optimize, and secure their infrastructure with minimal effort. You’ll be a key contributor in designing and implementing the systems behind this product, working across frontend, backend, and AI workflows. This role blends hands-on engineering with cross-functional collaboration, including product, infra, and customer-facing teams.

&##128640; What You'll own:
Build and maintain core features of our AI DevOps Copilot using React and/or Golang
Design scalable systems and APIs that resilient, observable, and easy to use
Contribute to agentic workflows that interface with LLMs, infrastructure metadata, and customer environments
Engage with users and internal teams to ship meaningful improvements fast
Take ownership of end-to-end feature, from problem discovery to production reliability
Share knowledge across the company via docs, PRs, internal talks, or blog posts

&##128161; What We're Looking For:
Strong experience with modern React , or Solid Golang skills with a clean, maintainable code with good testing practices. Real-world experience (production systems or open-source contributions)
Understanding of LLMs , agentic workflows, or automation tools
Comfortable working with structured logs, telemetry, and infra metadata
Ability to design robust, scalable, and failure-tolerant systems
Good grasp of infrastructure principles (latency, observability, fault tolerance)
Strong written communication: specs, PRs, internal/external documentation
Able to explain tradeoffs and design choices to technical and non-technical audiences
Experience mentoring, blogging, or contributing to open source is a plus
Experience in customer-facing roles (support, pre-sales, or product discovery)
Able to turn user feedback into actionable product improvements
Quick learner in unfamiliar domains (infra, AI, developer tools, etc.)
Takes initiative and drives work to completion independently
Thinks from the user’s perspective and builds with empathy
&##127919; Why Join Us:
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects that make a real impact for Developers like you!
Attracting benefits package
A flexible work environment with a fully remote environment
Continuous learning and professional development opportunities
An authentic company culture with a focus on collaboration and innovation

title: Lead Application Engineer - DevOps Engineering Lead F/M
description:
Requisition #: 16991

Ansys is now a part of Synopsys. Synopsys, Inc. (Nasdaq: SNPS) accelerates technology innovation from silicon to systems. Catalyzing the era of pervasive intelligence, we deliver design solutions, from electronic design automation to silicon IP, to system design and multiphysics simulation and analysis. We partner closely with our customers across a wide range of industries to maximize their R&D capability and productivity, powering innovation today that ignites the ingenuity of tomorrow. Learn more at www.synopsys.com.

Summary / Role Purpose

As Ansys Lead Application Engineer, you will work with a variety of customers in your application area of cloud/HPC Simulation vertical deployment and become a credible advisor for improving your customers' product development.

You will lead technical efforts in vertical application deployment, focusing on the scalability, robustness and performance of our developed solutions. Working at the intersection of IT infrastructure and development, you will play a role in shaping the success of deploying our technology in real-world environments in various industries and guide other team members in scaling our solutions.

This includes owning the design and execution of stress tests, refining deployment templates, and establishing best practices for containerization, Kubernetes orchestration, and CI/CD integration. Your leadership will ensure that our solutions are production-ready and can scale with confidence across diverse IT environments.

You will lead technical sales support activities and work with sales leaders to plan our go-to-market strategy for selected customers. You will scope or lead the delivery of professional services projects, provide customer consulting and help translate customer requirements into new product features.

You will take the lead in multidisciplinary teams to develop end-to-end simulation solutions and help expand our application areas and industry knowledge. By sharing your knowledge and experience within Ansys teams and with customers, you will enhance your reputation and become a sought-after person in your field of application.

Key Duties and Responsibilities
• Provide proactive and results-oriented leadership in the planning, coordination and execution of all technical activities throughout the lifecycle of a sales opportunity, such as technical discovery, negotiation of technical success criteria, product presentations, demonstrations and evaluations. Works independently, responsibly, across teams and organizations.
• Collaborate with Sales to drive the most competitive technical assignments to successful outcomes by leveraging your recognized thought leadership and expertise in the relevant application area.
• Interact with customers to understand their key business initiatives, product development needs and design workflows; analyze how Ansys products and platforms can meet and exceed the customer's goals and improve their key performance indicators; communicate the Ansys value proposition to senior management.
• Leading project teams to develop differentiated but reusable simulation solutions using the Ansys platform and products, deploying these solutions in customers' design workflows.
• Support for knowledge sharing and mentoring programs within Ansys.
• Work with Ansys product development teams to define the Ansys product roadmap; lead project teams testing new versions of Ansys products on industrial problems, develop best practices for applications.
• Demonstrate leadership and active engagement in Ansys initiatives to innovate offerings and solutions, improve technology and productivity, and develop people.
• Support the Ansys Field and Digital Marketing team by developing promotional materials and supporting events as well as writing and delivering conference presentations.
• Leading the delivery of professional services, providing customer consulting.
• Lead the design, implementation, and optimization of scalable, secure, and high-performing deployment architectures using Kubernetes and container technologies, including conducting performance and scalability testing of vertical applications and proactively identifying and resolving system bottlenecks.
• Contribute to architecture decisions and strategic planning, ensuring our deployment frameworks and platform scalability align with emerging trends and advancements in cloud infrastructure, DevOps, and deployment automation.

Minimum Education/Certification Requirements and Experience
• Required education and degree type: BS or MS or PhD in Mechanical/Chemical/Aerospace/Electrical Engineering or related field
• Required minimum years of professional experience in an engineering software environment: BS+8, MS+6, or PhD+3
• Demonstrated use of relevant Ansys software or knowledge of other commercial CAE, CAD, EDA, PLM software packages
• Subject matter expert in one or more relevant disciplines within Ansys’ business and is/will be sought out for advice by other Ansys engineers
• Demonstrated understanding of engineering practices and product development, experience with building solutions using simulation technology and deploying those solutions within customers’ engineering workflows
• Track record of delivering exceptional customer outcomes and revenue impact
• Strong leadership and mentoring skills
• Logical problem-solving, strong interpersonal and communication skills, fluent in writing and speaking English
• Ability to organize and manage multiple projects which are complex in nature, possesses a sense of urgency
• Projects a professional image and demonstrates business acumen, driven to succeed
• Ability to travel domestically up to 25% of time
• Proven experience (5+ years) in leading application deployments in production environments.
• Expertise with Kubernetes and container orchestration in large-scale deployments
• Expertise with multiple DevOps pipelines tools (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins) and Infrastructure as code (Terraform, Pulumi)
• Proficiency in performance testing, scalability analysis, and tuning of distributed systems
• Experience with monitoring and observability stacks (Grafana, OpenTelemetry)
• Solid understanding of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and hybrid/multi-cloud architectures
• Proficient in Python scripting, particularly using simulation software APIs and associated simulation related automation tools

Preferred Qualifications and Skills
• Preferred education and years of professional experience in an engineering software environment: BS+12, MS+10, or PhD+7
• 4 years of experience in application engineering, customer support, or consulting services type customer facing roles using engineering software
• Ability to interact effectively with senior business managers and C-level executives
• Ability to travel domestically up to 50% of time
• Basic understanding of programming languages such as: C# (.NET), Javascript, HTML,
• Practical knowledge of agility and agile project management

#LI-Hybrid

Rewards and Benefits:

We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.

At Ansys, part of Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. We consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.

title: Ingénieur DevOps F/H/X
description:
Who are we?

ARNEO est une agence digitale créative et engagée qui accompagne ses clients dans leur transition vers une approche plus responsable de leurs enjeux et de leurs modèles économiques.

L'expertise d'ARNEO s'appuie sur plusieurs domaines d'excellence de la réflexion, conception à la production : analyse de la performance, SEO/SEA, création, design, technologies, gestion de projet, e-commerce et conseil.

Notre objectif : proposer à nos clients une approche transversale pour construire la meilleure expérience utilisateur possible.

Job Description

En tant qu'Ingénieur DevOps au sein de notre département de production, vous serez responsable du développement et du maintien d’une infrastructure technologique performante et stable. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec nos équipes de développement et nos responsables techniques pour concevoir et déployer nos projets, tout en appliquant les meilleures pratiques et standards du marché. Vous jouerez également un rôle clé dans la gestion et la coordination des équipes techniques

Responsabilités :
• Implémentation et Maintenance des Infrastructures : Concevoir, déployer et maintenir les infrastructures système en garantissant leur stabilité, performance et sécurité.
• Automatisation des Déploiements : Créer et maintenir des pipelines d'intégration continue (CI) et de déploiement continu (CD), optimisant ainsi les cycles de développement et de livraison. Automatiser et améliorer les processus de développement et de déploiement.
• Gestion des Configurations : Gérer efficacement les configurations pour assurer la cohérence et la fiabilité des systèmes.
• Optimisation des Performances : Surveiller et optimiser les performances des applications et des serveurs afin d’offrir une expérience utilisateur optimale.
• Sécurité et Conformité : Mettre en œuvre des mesures de sécurité robustes et garantir la conformité avec les normes et régulations en vigueur. Assurer la protection des systèmes contre les menaces de cybersécurité.
• Pratiques DevOps : Veiller à l’application des bonnes pratiques Admin/DevOps. Collaborer efficacement avec les développeurs, chefs de projets, et autres parties prenantes. Effectuer une veille technologique dans tous les domaines du poste (Dev, Ops, DevOps, qualité, etc.).
• Gestion d'équipe : Encadrer et coordonner une équipe technique pour assurer la bonne exécution des projets. Favoriser l’esprit d’équipe et la collaboration inter-équipes. Soutenir le développement et la montée en compétences des membres de l’équipe. Gérer les priorités et répartir les tâches au sein de l’équipe en fonction des projets.

Compétences techniques :
• Expérience solide en administration système (principalement Linux).
• Maîtrise des outils de virtualisation et de conteneurisation (Docker, Kubernetes, Proxmox VE, etc.).
• Bonnes connaissances des écosystèmes Java, JavaScript et PHP.
• Maîtrise des outils d'automatisation (Ansible, Puppet, Chef, etc.).
• Maîtrise de GitLab CI/CD ou d'autres outils similaires.
• Expérience avec des outils d'assurance qualité du code (Sonar, Prettier, ESLint, etc.).

Arneo s’engage à promouvoir la diversité au sein de ses effectifs et à créer un environnement de travail inclusif. Nous étudions les candidatures de toutes personnes qualifiées, indépendamment de leur sexe, orientation sexuelle, race, origine ethnique, croyances, âge, état civil, handicap ou toute autre caractéristique

title: Ingénieur DevOps H/F
description:
Mission

Fort de plus de 150 collaborateurs en région Est, Inetum accompagne ses clients dans leurs projets d'intégration d'applications, de maintenance et de gestion d'infrastructures.

Pour accompagner la croissance d'Inetum, l'agence de Strasbourg recherche un DevOps (H/F) pour rejoindre l'équipe de notre client, en régie.

Rattaché(e) à votre manager de proximité, vous serez le garant du bon fonctionnement et de la disponibilité des réseaux dont vous aurez la responsabilité.

Pour cela, vous devrez :

• Garantir la disponibilité des services

• Gérer et améliorer l'automatisation de l'infrastructure

• Améliorer la surveillance et les tests de charge des applications

• Garantir le bon déroulement des délais des release

• Coder des infrastructures permettant d'apporter la traçabilité et la visibilité

• Appel à du support éditeur sur la partie backup /sécurité et Kubernetes

Compétences requises :

• Être à l'aise sur des environnements Linux

• Compétences sur les bases de données

• Maitrise de docker et Kubernetes

• A l'aise avec les environnements cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP)

Profil

Vous avez un Bac +5 ou vous bénéficiez d'une expérience professionnelle significative sur le même type de poste.

L'esprit d'équipe, le bon relationnel et les qualités rédactionnelles sont des atouts primordiaux, n'hésitez pas à postuler et venez nous rencontrer !

Les avantages chez Inetum :

Une carte Ticket Restaurant créditée de 9€ par jour travaillé (dont 60% à la charge d'INETUM)

Une prise en charge de 60% de votre abonnement de transports en commun ou indemnité kilométrique vélo à hauteur de 200€ par an

Une bonne mutuelle Santé et Prévoyance (par exemple : un service de téléconsultation accessible 7/7jrs 24/24h)

27 jours de congés payés (acquis au bout d'un an d'ancienneté) et 10 RTT par an

Un accord télétravail permettant 1 à 4 jours par semaine

Un CSE (subvention sport et loisir, chèques vacances, chaque cadeau de fin d'année, etc...)

Partenariats écoles, où vous pourrez intervenir pour des présentations techniques

Un accès illimité à la plateforme GOFLUENT pour améliorer votre niveau en langue (Anglais, Espagnol, Allemand, ...)

Organisation

Inetum est un leader européen des services numériques. Pour les entreprises, les acteurs publics et la société dans son ensemble, les 28 000 consultants et spécialistes du groupe visent chaque jour l'impact digital : des solutions qui contribuent à la performance, à l'innovation et au bien commun.

Présent dans 19 pays au plus près des territoires, et avec ses grands partenaires éditeurs de logiciels, Inetum répond aux enjeux de la transformation digitale avec proximité et flexibilité.

Porté par son ambition de croissance et d'industrialisation, Inetum a généré en 2023 un chiffre d'affaires de 2,5 milliards d'€.

Pour répondre à un marché en croissance continue depuis plus de 30ans, Inetum a fait le choix délibéré de se recentrer sur 4 métiers afin de gagner en puissance et proposer des solutions sur mesure, adaptées aux besoins spécifiques de ses clients : le conseil (Inetum Consulting), la gestion des infrastructures et applications à façon (Inetum Technologies), l'implémentation de progiciels (Inetum Solutions) et sa propre activité d'éditeur de logiciels (Inetum Software). Inetum a conclu des partenariats stratégiques avec 4 grands éditeurs mondiaux - Salesforce, ServiceNow, Microsoft et SAP et poursuit une stratégie d'acquisitions dédiée afin d'entrer dans le top 5 européen sur ces technologies et proposer la meilleure expertise à ses clients.

Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.

title: Senior Cloud & DevOps Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Senior Cloud & DevOps Engineer to join our growing Infrastructure and DevOps Team. In this position, you will improve, maintain, and administer our development and production environments and you will have ownership of the core infrastructure of the EmailTree platform. You will be our center of technical excellence regarding Cloud and DevOps tools and technologies including Azure, Kubernetes, and CI/CD. You will be tasked with reducing our time to delivery by automating development processes and improving our developer experience. Extremely broad and deep knowledge of DevOps and Cloud platforms and tools is a must.

You will work closely with Frontend and Backend Software Engineers, AI/Machine Learning Engineers, Data Scientists, QA Engineers, Product Owners, stakeholders, and of course other members of the Infrastructure and DevOps team.

Responsibilities
• Lead broad and highly visible efforts to improve our development processes and developer experience in a highly impactful way.
• Provide technical direction regarding tooling, integrations, automation, and security.
• Demonstrate deep and broad knowledge of storage, security, networking, and automation technologies.
• Lead the implementation of major infrastructure improvements and optimizations.
• Ensure the day-to-day development processes are continually improving.
• Develop and communicate a long-term Cloud and DevOps strategy.
• Mentor and educate your colleagues, and increase the competency of Cloud and DevOps across EmailTree.
• Communicate upcoming plans, improvements, refactors, and other aspects of your work clearly and transparently even when it may not have an impact on others.

Required Qualifications
• At least 6 years of relevant professional experience.
• At least 5 years of experience supporting SaaS or PaaS software development teams in an agile environment, for instance by automating development processes, creating CI/CD pipelines, administrating development environments, managing deployments, and performing other similar duties.
• At least 4 years of experience developing and managing technical environments for a team of more than 10 developers.
• At least 4 years of experience creating CI/CD pipelines and using tools like Jenkins, Argo, Git, BitBucket, and JIRA for automating processes.
• At least 3 years of professional experience with Kubernetes and Helm.
• At least 3 years of Cloud experience with Azure, GCP, AWS, or another cloud computing platform.
• Experience deploying applications to the cloud and administering and maintaining those applications.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills regardless of who you may be communicating with, be it a manager, teammate, customer, investor, or another party.
• Strong knowledge of scripting languages such as BASH or Python and the YAML or JSON data formats.

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience with logging and monitoring solutions for Kuberrnetes
• Experience with Sentry
• Deploy of on-prem Kubernetes clusters behind VPNs and/or firewalls, proxy, etc.
• 5 or more years of relevant professional experience.
• 5 or more years of experience managing software development environments and improving developer experiences.
• 5 or more years of experience automating the delivery of customer-facing software.
• 5 or more years of experience packaging, via containerization or otherwise, and deploying SaaS applications in both on-premise and cloud environments.
• 3 or more years of experience orchestrating and developing infrastructure for microservices.
• 3 or more years of experience working with Azure, especially regarding the deployment and administration of transactional applications on Azure.
• 3 or more years of experience developing infrastructure for software that heavily utilised artificial intelligence and machine learning.
• 1 or more years of experience leading a DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure Engineering team.
• Experience with Azure Active Directory and Single Sign-On.
• Experience migrating monolithic software projects to microservices.
• Experience implementing and enforcing information security standards such as ISO 27001.

title: Ingénieur DevOps (H/F) – Lyon
description:
Ingénieur DevOps (H/F) - Lyon

Type de poste : CDI

Région : Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes

Et si vous étiez notre futur Ingénieur DevOps talentueux et motivé ?

Vous croyez que l'évolution et la curiosité sont les clés du succès, et que chaque défi est une opportunité d'apprendre et de grandir ? Alors nous partageons la même vision ! Pourquoi ne pas en discuter ensemble ?

Pour commencer, qui sommes-nous ?

Créée en 2012, Synapsys est une société de conseil et d’expertise spécialisée dans la transformation des infrastructures IT. Notre mission ? Accompagner les plus grandes entreprises tout au long du cycle de vie de leurs projets de transformation numérique.

Nos Domaines D’expertise Sont
• Digital Workplace
• Cloud & DevOps
• Cybersécurité
• Transformation des SI
• Data & IA

Et les Squads dans tout ça ?

Synapsys est organisé autour de communautés d’expertise que l’on appelle des “Squads” et dans lesquelles le partage et l’entraide sont de mise. En rejoignant votre Squad, vous rejoignez un collectif qui vous suivra tout au long de votre carrière et de vos missions.

Vous pourrez prendre part à la vie de la Squad : projets internes, animation d’ateliers et de conférences, contribution au business et au recrutement, rédaction de tribunes d’experts...

Vos Responsabilités

En tant qu’Ingénieur DevOps, voici votre terrain de jeu :
• Collaborer avec les équipes de développement pour automatiser les déploiements avec la mise en place de pipelines CI/CD (GitLab, Jenkins, CircleCI…)
• Apporter le support aux équipes opérationnelles en charge du déploiement des solutions.
• Mettre en œuvre des outils DevOps (Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Travis CI, Cloud Build…)
• Participer au développement d’environnements serverless (Lambda, API Gateway, S3, DynamoDB) ou microservices (Docker, Kubernetes).
• Mettre en place des outils de monitoring et analyser la performance.
• Intégrer et tester les applications dans les différents environnements techniques.
• Assurer la disponibilité des services, la sécurité et la conformité des infrastructures.
• Accompagner et former les équipes à l’adoption des outils et des processus DevOps.
• Assurer la veille technologique sur les outils et l’évolution des pratiques.

Last but not least, être un Rhino chez Synapsys Lyon c’est…
• Une entreprise à taille humaine soucieuse de la qualité de vie professionnelle des consultants : choix des missions, on-boarding sur mesure...
• Un suivi de carrière de proximité pour chaque consultant, avec le Chargé RH, le Manager et le Référent Technique.
• Un dispositif d’évolution des compétences porté par les Squads : formations, certifications, plateforme e-learning, coaching...
• Des missions variées à la pointe de la technologie, au sein d’environnements grands comptes stimulants.
• Des moments conviviaux inter-agences : soirées squads, meet-up, ateliers squads, summer party…
• Une société engagée qui soutient les principes de Green IT et de sobriété numérique en interne et auprès de ses clients.

Chez Synapsys, nous célébrons la diversité et nous nous engageons à créer un environnement inclusif où chacun peut s'épanouir. Rejoignez-nous et apportez votre touche unique à notre équipe !

Si vous avez des questions, n’hésitez pas à nous contacter ! Sinon, vous n’avez plus qu’à postuler !

Postuler

title: Ingénieur Cloud AWS (F/H)
description:
Description du poste
En tant qu'organisateur de forums de recrutement, Talents Handicap accompagne de très nombreuses entreprises & organisations en France dans leurs recrutements de collaborateurs en situation de handicap. Participant actuellement à l'un de nos forums. L'entreprise Atos recherche actuellement des profils :

Le poste en quelques mots :

En tant qu'Ingénieur cloud AWS vous serez responsable de la gestion, de la maintenance et de l'optimisation des infrastructures cloud hébergées sur Amazon Web Services (AWS). Veiller à la disponibilité, la sécurité et la performance des services cloud utilisés par nos clients.

Ce que vous allez faire si vous nous rejoignez :
• Concevoir, déployer et optimiser des architectures cloud sur AWS.
• Automatiser le déploiement et la gestion des infrastructures via Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation).
• Assurer la disponibilité, la performance et la sécurité des environnements cloud.
• Mettre en place et maintenir des pipelines CI/CD pour le déploiement d'applications.
• Administrer et superviser les services cloud en utilisant des outils de monitoring et de gestion des logs.
• Optimiser les coûts et la scalabilité des solutions cloud.
• Collaborer avec les équipes DevOps et de développement pour garantir l'intégration et la fiabilité des services.
• Assurer une veille technologique et proposer des évolutions architecturales adaptées aux besoins des clients.

Compétences Techniques :
• Excellente maîtrise des services AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, VPC, IAM, etc.).
• Expertise en Infrastructure as Code avec Terraform et/ou AWS CloudFormation.
• Expérience en intégration et déploiement continus (CI/CD) avec des outils comme GitLab CI, Jenkins, AWS CodePipeline.
• Compétences en scripting et automatisation (Python, Bash, Ansible).
• Connaissance des architectures serverless et microservices.
• Expérience avec des solutions de conteneurisation et d'orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, EKS).
• Bonne maîtrise des outils de monitoring et de logging (CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, ELK).
• Sensibilité aux bonnes pratiques de cybersécurité et de gestion des accès dans un environnement cloud.

title: DevOps Engineer, REMOTE
DevOps F/H | LILLE
description:
Vous souhaitez intégrer des projets ambitieux ? Nous vous proposons une opportunité de DevOps (F/H).

🚀 Parlons de votre mission

Dans le cadre de notre Offre Digital & Innovation et du fort développement de notre présence chez nos clients grand comptes, nous recherchons un DevOps.

Grâce à des compétences éprouvées, vous :
• Mettez en place et optimisez les pipelines d’intégration et de déploiement continus (CI/CD)
• Automatisez les tâches récurrentes pour améliorer l’efficacité des équipes de développement et d’exploitation
• Assurez la gestion, la configuration et la supervision des infrastructures (cloud ou on-premises)
• Mettez en œuvre des outils de monitoring pour garantir la disponibilité et les performances des applications
• Collaborez avec les développeurs pour intégrer les bonnes pratiques DevOps dès la conception
• Garantissez la sécurité et la conformité des processus de déploiement
• Participez à la résolution d’incidents critiques et à l’amélioration continue des systèmes

💪 Parlons de vous

Votre expertise vous a permis de développer un réel attrait pour l’intégration continue. De formation Bac +5 en informatique, vous bénéficiez d’au moins 5 ans d’expérience sur un poste similaire.

Vous avez l’esprit d'équipe, un bon relationnel ainsi qu’une grande capacité d'adaptation et d’analyse avec une rigueur et une méthodologie de haute fiabilité.

La maitrise de l’anglais est indispensable aussi bien à l’oral, qu’à l’écrit.

💻 Parlons de vos compétences
• Pour vous épanouir sur ce poste, vous êtes à l’aise dans les environnements suivants :
• Outils CI/CD (Jenkins, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps, etc.)
• Scripting et programmation (Python, Bash, etc.)
• Conteneurisation (Docker, Kubernetes)
• Plateformes cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP)
• Infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible)
• Supervision et monitoring (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, etc.)

💥 Pourquoi nous ?

En 2025, Synchrone se transforme et inscrit ses 1 500 collaborateurs au centre d’un projet d’entreprise ambitieux et créateur de valeur pour tous : Impulse Value.

Référencée auprès des plus grands groupes français et internationaux, elle déploie une nouvelle offre de valeur orientée conseil et place la Data, l’IA, la transformation digitale et le Cloud au cœur de son développement.

Nos secteurs de prédilection : Luxe, Banque/Assurance, Retail, Transport, Média & Télécoms, Energie & Environnement, Internet & Software, Industrie & Services.

ESN engagée, inclusive et handi-accueillante, Synchrone recrute et reconnait tous les talents !

-----

Rejoindre Synchrone, c’est être au centre de notre projet d’entreprise Impluse value. C’est choisir un parcours conseil riche en expériences et un chemin de carrière guidé par la montée en compétences.

C’est impulser sa valeur au cœur d’un écosystème en mouvement, pour soi, pour Synchrone et pour ses clients.

⬆️ Level Up | Un programme qui dessine une trajectoire carrière claire et concrète : 4 rôles additionnels pour développer ses compétences et son impact, 2 chemins de carrière pour élever sa carrière au niveau supérieur.

💼 Développement des compétences | Un accès à la plateforme e-learning Udemy Business pour tous nos salariés et des parcours éditeurs en fonction de votre domaine d’expertise.

title: Devops / Software engineer messagerie (Zimbra)
description:
Au sein de votre équipe #OneTeam

En tant que Devops/Software engineer vous serez chargé de garantir la performance, la stabilité et la fiabilité de nos infrastructures de messagerie incluant des produits Zimbra. Vous identifierez les opportunités d'optimisation, proposerez des solutions innovantes et les mettrez en œuvre pour améliorer les outils et les processus existants. Vous serez le garant de la qualité de nos services et le défenseur de la satisfaction de nos clients.

Vos principales responsabilités

• Développer des fonctionnalités qui font la différence : vous créerez de nouvelles fonctionnalités pour améliorer les outils existants et les rendre plus efficaces.

• Résoudre les problèmes complexes : vous proposerez des solutions pour résoudre les problèmes complexes et participerez à l'activité de R&D de l'équipe.

• Maintenir les systèmes en conditions opérationnelles : vous maintiendrez en conditions opérationnelles les outils et les systèmes de production pour garantir la disponibilité et la performance des services clients

• Analyser les indicateurs et les logs : vous analyserez les indicateurs et les logs pour détecter les tendances et les événements particuliers qui pourraient impacter la qualité de nos services.

• Traiter les alertes : vous traiterez les alertes générées par les infrastructures de production pour garantir la réactivité et la qualité de nos services.

• Sensibiliser les clients et les collaborateurs : vous sensibiliserez les clients et les collaborateurs à la mise en place de bonnes pratiques pour améliorer les systèmes en place ou futurs.

Votre futur impact

Dans 6 mois
• Se familiariser avec les flux de travail de l'équipe, les normes de codage et les pipelines de déploiement.
• Établir de solides relations de travail avec les membres de l'équipe.
• Contribuer aux améliorations et/ou optimisations.
• Acquérir une bonne compréhension du flux OVH Email existant et du système qui l'entoure.

Et dans 1 an
• Contribuer au développement du produit et à la création de la prochaine itération.
• Maintenir des standards élevés de sécurité et d'échelle d'infrastructure.
• Concevoir et tester d'autres systèmes de collaboration qui peuvent être intégrés.

Compétences requises :

• Bonnes connaissances en Zimbra (V9 et V10 de préférence) et en technologies de messagerie (IMAP, SMTP, DKIM, SPF, SRS...).

• Anglais : niveau B2 minimum

• Capacité analytique et de synthèse

• Capacité à travailler dans un environnement international

• Capacité d'adaptation et flexibilité

title: Site Reliability Engineer - EMEA Remote
description:
Description

Here at Hugging Face, we’re on a journey to advance good Machine Learning and make it more accessible. Along the way, we contribute to the development of technology for the better.

We have built the fastest-growing, open-source, library of pre-trained models in the world. With more than 500K+ models and 250K+ stars on GitHub, over 15.000 companies are using HF technology in production, including leading AI organizations such as Google, Elastic, Salesforce, Algolia, and Grammarly.

About the role:

We are looking for a Site Reliability Engineer responsible for maintaining and scaling our product infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have experience maintaining large infrastructure for AI workflows and strong experience supporting teams to create best practices for reliability and scalability.

Responsabilities:
• Design, develop, deploy, and maintain reliable and scalable infrastructure.
• Manage large Kubernetes clusters.
• Measure and optimize system performance.
• Patch infrastructure to avoid vulnerabilities.
• Keep important, revenue-critical systems up and running despite outages and configuration errors.
• Provide primary operational support and engineering for multiple teams.

Qualifications:
• 7+ years of experience in a Site Reliability Engineer or Infrastructure Engineer role.
• Strong knowledge of cloud providers such as AWS, GCP, infra-as-code frameworks and observability tools.
• Strong communication, collaboration, and documentation skills.
• Experience with Linux, Git, containers, networking and command line tools.
• Collaborate and communicate asynchronously.

About you:

If you are a passionate Site Reliability Engineer with a keen interest in AI and thrive in a challenging and innovative setting, we would love to hear from you. Join our team and contribute to the advancement of AI technologies while working alongside talented professionals in a collaborative and stimulating environment.

More about Hugging Face

We are actively working to build a culture that values diversity, equity, and inclusivity. We are intentionally building a workplace where people feel respected and supported—regardless of who you are or where you come from. We believe this is foundational to building a great company and community. Hugging Face is an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We value development. You will work with some of the smartest people in our industry. We are an organization that has a bias for impact and is always challenging ourselves to continuously grow. We provide all employees with reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.

We care about your well-being. We offer flexible working hours and remote options. We offer health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents. We also offer parental leave and flexible paid time off.

We support our employees wherever they are. While we have office spaces in NYC and Paris, we're very distributed and all remote employees have the opportunity to visit our offices. If needed, we'll also outfit your workstation to ensure you succeed.

We want our teammates to be shareholders. All employees have company equity as part of their compensation package. If we succeed in becoming a category-defining platform in machine learning and artificial intelligence, everyone enjoys the upside.

We support the community. We believe major scientific advancements are the result of collaboration across the field. Join a community supporting the ML/AI community.

title: Devops Engineer / Dynamics Crm /.Net
description:
Here at SoftwareOne, we give you the flexibility to ignite your spark of creativity, without limits. We encourage autonomy and thinking creatively - and we can’t wait to hear your new insights. Although all businesses say it, we truly believe in work-life harmony. Our people are our greatest asset, and we’ll go above and beyond to ensure you’re happy here. Why SoftwareOne?

Here at SoftwareOne, we give you the flexibility to ignite your spark of creativity, without limits. We encourage autonomy and thinking creatively - and we can’t wait to hear your new insights. Although all businesses say it, we truly believe in work-life harmony. Our people are our greatest asset, and we’ll go above and beyond to ensure you’re happy here. We want our people to be their true authentic selves at all times, because that’s when real creativity happens.

The role

You are either a developer interested in deployment and network operations, or a sysadmin passionate about scripting and coding, looking to move into development to improve test and deployment planning.

Either way, you have expanded beyond your defined areas of competence and have a multidisciplinary view of your technical environments!

What we need to see from you

Develop reliable and stable deployment processes for cloud-based web applications and microservices in collaboration with engineering teams. Contribute to developing agile methods of software development within the company to improve operational processes. Coordinate and develop security and infrastructure concepts aligned with development, security, and infrastructure departments.

Your qualifications
5+ years of experience as a professional developer or sysadmin in a Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM & .NET/Azure cloud environment. Familiarity with infrastructure provisioning, administration, deployment, monitoring, and test automation, along with software development lifecycle knowledge. Comfort with incremental code builds, testing, and deployment. Strong automation skills and familiarity with automation tools. Focus on business outcomes and simplicity in configuration and automation management. Expertise in Azure DevOps, Git, C#, Docker. Operational experience in Windows/Linux/Unix environments and scripting languages like PowerShell, Shell, Perl, Python. Experience with Microsoft Azure or Amazon AWS in a production setting is a plus. Proficiency in English (speaking, reading, writing). #J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Site Reliability Engineer - Aws Cloud & Devops
description:
At Leadtech, we’ve been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we’re united by a passion for creativity and collaboration.

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We’re proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page.

As a Site Reliability Engineer – AWS Cloud & DevOps , you’ll play a key role in designing, maintaining, and optimizing our cloud infrastructure. You will work with a wide array of AWS services, automate processes, ensure platform reliability and security, and support high-performance systems. This position is perfect for someone with strong DevOps fundamentals, hands-on cloud experience, and a problem-solving mindset. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams including Development, BI, and Security to build scalable and secure environments.

Key Responsibilities :
Design and manage AWS infrastructure using Terraform and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles. Develop and maintain CI / CD pipelines with Jenkins for deployment automation. Build packaging pipelines using tools like Maven or npm (desirable). Automate workflows using Shell and Groovy (required), with Python or PowerShell (desirable). Manage and troubleshoot UNIX / Linux or BSD systems in production environments. Ensure robust cloud security using best practices (SSL / TLS, KMS, IAM, WAF). Monitor, optimize, and troubleshoot infrastructure and application issues. Maintain and scale AWS services including Lambda, CloudFront, EC2, ECS, API Gateway, S3, and OpenSearch. Manage network configurations including TCP / IP, Route Tables, VPCs, Route 53, and Security Groups. Administer databases such as PostgreSQL, MySQL / MariaDB, DynamoDB, and optionally Firestore. Support Docker-based environments and manage container orchestration with AWS ECS (Kubernetes is a plus). Operate and support tools like SonarQube, Nexus, and Dependency Track.

Requirements

Required Qualifications :
Experience : 3–4+ years of hands-on experience as an SRE, DevOps Engineer, or Systems Administrator in cloud environments. Cloud Platforms : Strong hands-on experience with AWS and core services (Lambda, EC2, ECS, S3, API Gateway, CloudFront, WAF, OpenSearch). IaC : Proficient in Terraform. CI / CD : Expertise in Jenkins for creating and maintaining pipelines. Scripting : Solid experience with Shell and Groovy scripting; Python or PowerShell is a plus. OS : Advanced administration skills in UNIX / Linux / BSD systems. Networking : Solid understanding of TCP / IP, VPCs, DNS (Route 53), Security Groups, and Route Tables. Databases : Experience with PostgreSQL, MySQL / MariaDB, and DynamoDB. Security : Familiarity with SSL / TLS, IAM roles, and KMS. Tools : Experience with SonarQube and Dependency Track (Nexus is a plus). Languages : Professional proficiency in English and Spanish.

Nice-to-Have Skills :
Experience with Kubernetes (K8s). Familiarity with packaging tools like Maven or npm. Broader programming knowledge beyond scripting. Experience with Firestore and additional cloud platforms. Background in high-traffic web environments. Experience with additional monitoring tools (e.g., CloudWatch, Grafana).

Desired Personal Competencies :
Ability to work independently and proactively. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and documentation skills. A mindset focused on continuous improvement and automation.

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?

Growth and career development
At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities.

Work-Life balance
Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9 : 30 a.m. start, 3 : 30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer! Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services). 25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options—no blackout days! If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you’ll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views. Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary.

Join us in an environment where you’re free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you’ll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Sounds good? Apply now! We’re looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer :

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressión and / or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona’s Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Location: 80% on-site work in Strasbourg, and 20% off-site.

ASTRELYA est un groupe de conseil et d’expertise IT fondé en 2017, présent en France (Paris et régions) et en Suisse (Genève). Aujourd'hui plus de 280 collaborateurs accompagnent nos clients dans l’accélération et la transformation de leurs organisations.

Profil recherché :

title: Senior Devops Engineer And Aws Cdk Specialist
description:
Would you like to partake in technical challenges, collaborate on an interesting product, be up to date with the latest technology, and contribute to taking our product to market? Then keep reading!

Yes, tell me more…

fullinfo is a startup B2B data services software company.

We are building an un-paralleled data collection pipeline which is being deployed on AWS and written in Go and Typescript. With a focus on innovation, quality, and accessibility, we are developing a one-stop lead generator platform.

The Customer facing part of the solution is a Typescript and GraphQL based web application. Deployed on AWS as well. Serverless paradigm is being applied :

Most of our code is running as AWS’s Lambda’s.

We are currently hiring a Senior-Level DevOps Engineer and AWS CDK Specialist for an initial 12-month Fixed Term Contract. The ideal candidate will have experience with AWS (EDA architecture) and TypeScript and be willing to pick up new technologies as needed.

Responsibilities :
Participate in our DevOps team Ensure the quality of our AWS infrastructure Develop and review infrastructure code that enhances performance and cost efficiency Ensure seamless integration of all AWS services within our architecture Optimize the infrastructure for continuous scalability Drive ongoing improvements in CI / CD pipelines Collaborate with development teams, the CTO, and technical leads

Requirements :
A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related field A minimum of 6 years of professional experience working in DevOps roles Production experience with TypeScript and AWS CDK Coding experience in implementing business features and CDK constructs Professional experience creating infrastructure for AWS services, including Lambda, API Gateway, S3, CloudFront, EventBridge, AppSync, DynamoDB, and OpenSearch

The successful candidate will…
Be comfortable working remotely and independently, with some overlap with HQ work schedule Take ownership and be accountable for their work Be eager to work on various aspects of our cloud infrastructure in a generalist role Quickly familiarize themselves with our infrastructure to generate new ideas and improve our existing setup Have experience supporting other teams in implementing AWS solutions Adopt a proactive, hands-on approach Be experienced with or passionate about guiding other developers Take on a proactive, hands-on approach

What can you expect from us?
To shape the company from the ground up – join our team as a pioneer and help us carve our way forward. Together we’ll take our product to market – how cool would it be to celebrate together?A flat hierarchical structure with room for innovation in a highly motivated team. A start-up environment that is passionate about quality, problem solving and building beautiful software. Office in Rotterdam, located in the Rotterdam Science Tower. Office in Amsterdam, located in Apollolaan.

Our passion stems from our shared values and mission. With that said, our culture is built on two major aspects :

Quality :

At fullinfo we have show-and-tell energy, and we let the quality of our product speak for itself. We love building beautiful software and get hyped by always raising the bar on quality. Our product is beautiful inside and outside. How do we achieve this? By always asking ourselves “Is this right?” or “Does this make sense?”.

Problem Solving :

We foster innovation and novel approaches to problem solving, while keeping user needs at front of mind.

title: Student DevOps Engineer Fall 2025
description:

The SunLife DevOps team is made up of individuals with various technical skills and backgrounds.
